required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Safety and Efficacy Study of Two Japanese Encephalitis Vaccines ChimeriVax™-JE and JE-VAX
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicentre, Randomized, Double-blind, Phase III Study of The Comparative Immunogenicity, Safety and Tolerability of Two Japanese Encephalitis Vaccines (ChimeriVax™-JE and JE-VAX®)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine non-inferiority in seroconversion and to compare the safety and tolerability between ChimeriVaxTM-JE and JE-VAX to the respective homologous virus strain after completion of vaccination course.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Japanese Encephalitis (Homologous Virus) Seroconversion Following Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax® Vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Antibodies to Japanese encephalitis (JE) were measured by 50% plaque reduction neutralization test (PRNT50). Seroconversion was defined as a titer of ≥ 1:10.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Treatment Emergent Local Adverse Events and Treatment Emergent Systemic Reactions Post-Vaccination With Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax®
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (Pre-vaccination) up to 60 days post-first vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent local adverse events: Pain, Erythema, Pruritus, Swelling, Induration, and others as reported. Treatment emergent systemic reactions: Fatigue, Malaise, Chills, Pyrexia, Headache, Myalgia, Arthralgia, Diarrhea, Nausea, Vomiting, and Rash.

secondary_outcome.measure: Neutralizing Antibody Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) to Japanese Encephalitis (Homologous Virus) Following Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax® Vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Antibodies to Japanese encephalitis (JE) were measured by 50% plaque reduction neutralization test (PRNT50).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants in the Japanese Encephalitis (Homologous Virus) Neutralizing Antibody Titer Categories on Day 60 Following Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax® Vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Antibodies to Japanese encephalitis (JE) were measured by 50% plaque reduction neutralization test (PRNT50).

arm_group.description: Participants received dose each of saline placebo on Days 0 and 7. On Day 30, participants received vaccinations of ChimeriVax™-JE vaccine and saline placebo into different arms.
Participants received 1 dose each of JE-VAX® vaccine on Days 0, 7, and 30, and a dose of saline placebo into a different arm on Day 30.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects aged 18 or above
- Subjects in good general health.
- Females must have negative pregnancy test and be using adequate form of contraception
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of vaccination/infection with JE or Yellow fever or other flaviviruses
- History of residence/travel to flavivirus endemic regions
- History of anaphylaxis/serious adverse reactions
- Administration of vaccine within 30 days of study or during treatment period
- Clinically significant physical exam/medical history/lab abnormalities
- Pregnancy
- Excessive alcohol/drug abuse
- Hypersensitivity to constituents of JE-VAX®
- Blood transfusion/treatment with blood product within 6months of study and during study treatment period
- Known/suspected immunodeficiency
- Compromised blood brain barrier
- Employees of Clinical Research Organization (CRO)/study site staff
- Any other condition which would exclude subject.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled and treated from 07 November 2005 to 15 November 2006 at 5 clinical centers in Australia and 5 clinical centers in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 820 participants who met all of the inclusion criteria and none of the exclusion criteria were enrolled and vaccinated.

group.title: JE-VAX®
group.description: All participants received 1 subcutaneous dose each of JE-VAX® vaccine on Days 0, 7, and 30, and a subcutaneous dose of saline placebo into a different arm on Day 30.

group.title: ChimeriVax™-JE
group.description: All participants received 1 dose each of saline placebo on Days 0 and 7. On Day 30, participants received vaccinations of ChimeriVax™-JE vaccine 4 log10 Plaque-forming unit (PFU) and saline placebo into different arms.

group.title: JE-VAX®
group.description: All participants received 1 subcutaneous dose each of JE-VAX® vaccine on Days 0, 7, and 30, and a subcutaneous dose of saline placebo into a different arm on Day 30.

group.title: ChimeriVax™-JE
group.description: All participants received 1 dose each of saline placebo on Days 0 and 7. On Day 30, participants received vaccinations of ChimeriVax™-JE vaccine 4 log10 Plaque-forming unit (PFU) and saline placebo into different arms.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Japanese Encephalitis (Homologous Virus) Seroconversion Following Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax® Vaccination
outcome.description: Antibodies to Japanese encephalitis (JE) were measured by 50% plaque reduction neutralization test (PRNT50). Seroconversion was defined as a titer of ≥ 1:10.
outcome.population: Seroconversion was assessed in all participants who were seronegative to JE (both Nakayama and ChimeriVax™-JE strains) at baseline and had no protocol violations that would have interfered with evaluation of primary outcomes (Efficacy Population).

group.title: JE-VAX®
group.description: All participants received 1 subcutaneous dose each of JE-VAX® vaccine on Days 0, 7, and 30, and a subcutaneous dose of saline placebo into a different arm on Day 30.

group.title: ChimeriVax™-JE
group.description: All participants received 1 subcutaneous dose each of saline placebo on Days 0 and 7. On Day 30, participants received vaccinations of ChimeriVax™-JE vaccine 4 log10 PFU and saline placebo into different arms.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Japanese Encephalitis (Homologous Virus) Seroconversion Following Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax® Vaccination
measure.description: Antibodies to Japanese encephalitis (JE) were measured by 50% plaque reduction neutralization test (PRNT50). Seroconversion was defined as a titer of ≥ 1:10.
measure.population: Seroconversion was assessed in all participants who were seronegative to JE (both Nakayama and ChimeriVax™-JE strains) at baseline and had no protocol violations that would have interfered with evaluation of primary outcomes (Efficacy Population).

measurement_list.measurement: Seroconversion was not assessed at this time point for this group.

outcome.title: Neutralizing Antibody Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) to Japanese Encephalitis (Homologous Virus) Following Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax® Vaccination

outcome.population: Geometric mean titers were assessed in all participants who were seronegative to JE (both Nakayama and ChimeriVax™-JE strains) at baseline and had no protocol violations that would have interfered with evaluation of primary outcomes (Efficacy Population).

measure.population: Geometric mean titers were assessed in all participants who were seronegative to JE (both Nakayama and ChimeriVax™-JE strains) at baseline and had no protocol violations that would have interfered with evaluation of primary outcomes (Efficacy Population).

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting Treatment Emergent Local Adverse Events and Treatment Emergent Systemic Reactions Post-Vaccination With Either ChimeriVax™-JE or JE-Vax®
outcome.description: Treatment emergent local adverse events: Pain, Erythema, Pruritus, Swelling, Induration, and others as reported. Treatment emergent systemic reactions: Fatigue, Malaise, Chills, Pyrexia, Headache, Myalgia, Arthralgia, Diarrhea, Nausea, Vomiting, and Rash.
outcome.time_frame: Day 0 (Pre-vaccination) up to 60 days post-first vaccination
outcome.population: Treatment emergent local adverse events and systemic reactions were assessed in all subjects who had at least one injection (ChimeriVax™-JE, JE-Vax®, or placebo), according to the treatment actually received (Safety Population).

measure.population: Treatment emergent local adverse events and systemic reactions were assessed in all subjects who had at least one injection (ChimeriVax™-JE, JE-Vax®, or placebo), according to the treatment actually received (Safety Population).

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events data were collected from Day 0 (post-vaccination) through Day 60 post first vaccination.

group.title: JE-VAX®
group.description: All participants received 1 subcutaneous dose each of JE-VAX® vaccine on Days 0, 7, and 30, and a subcutaneous dose of saline placebo into a different arm on Day 30.

group.description: All participants received 1 dose each of saline placebo on Days 0 and 7. On Day 30, participants received vaccinations of ChimeriVax™-JE vaccine 4 log10 Plaque-forming unit (PFU) and saline placebo into different arms.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor must have the opportunity to review at least 60 days prior to submission for publication or presentation. If review indicates that potentially patentable subject matter would be disclosed, publication or public disclosure may be delayed for a maximum of an additional 60 days to allow for filing the necessary patent applications.
